page.title: 19Oxfordshire Schools Crisis.
page.content: The teachers in our school are still refusing to supervise the children at lunchtime. It could mean thousands of pupils being sent out on to the streets in towns around the country because there is no one to keep an eye on them. The teachers are taking this action as a protest to support their pay claim. In the 'Abingdon Herald' this week Mr. Ian Nickless, secretary of the National Association of Head Teachers said "To have a head left with two or three unqualified supervisors with 800-900 students is a crazy situation. In the last couple of years heads have been coming under increasing strain at lunch-time." Teachers have been offered a pay rise of over 5% but they feel this is not enough especially as inflation is currently running at 7%.
